description:
**Description**:</br>
Given an n x n matrix where each row and column is sorted in non-decreasing order, find the kth smallest element in the matrix. Note that it is the kth smallest element in the sorted order, not the kth distinct element.

**`Input:`**</br>
•	`An n x n matrix where 1 <= n <= 300.`</br>
•	`All elements of the matrix are integers within the range [1, 10^9].`</br>
•	`1 <= k <= n^2.`

**`Output:`**</br>
`Return the kth smallest element in the matrix.`

**`Example:`**</br>
**`Input:`**</br>
matrix = 
[   [ 1,  5,  9],  
   [10, 11, 13],  
   [12, 13, 15]
],</br>
k = 8</br>
**`Output:`**
13</br>

**`Explanation:`**</br>
`The 8th smallest element in the matrix is 13.`</br>

**`Constraints:`**</br>
•	`The matrix is guaranteed to have distinct integers.`</br>
•	`You may assume that the input matrix is always valid.`
title: Kth Smallest Element in a Sorted Matrix

code_skeletons.skeleton_define_class:

    public int kthSmallest(int[][] matrix, int k) {
